intro: Delphinium austriacum subsp. drescheri, commonly known as the Austrian larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Alps of Central Europe. It typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring tall, sparsely branched stems with lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are arranged in dense spikes, with blue to purple petals that are characteristic of the delphinium genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine meadows. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
